game_description: Hello, Island Spirit! A group of adorable sailors have been marooned on your shore. Let‚Äôs help them build a home here. And just maybe, they can help us repair the island‚Äôs broken heart. Explore the eight beautiful and distinct climates of the island, and with fishing, cooking, farming, mining, painting, themed decorations, and many hours of story quests, you won‚Äôt run out of things to do. You can invite a friend if you wish, just make sure to watch out for the Raccoons!
Languages: English, French (France), German, Japanese, Korean, Spanish (Mexico)
review_1: I am yet to complete the game, however it's the closest you'll get to vr animal crossing. It's super fun and the npc's are very lovable. There are Minor bugs, but what vr game is bugless. The only complaint that I could muster about this adorable game is that there is now way in the options to change your hight; so if you take the head set off without pausing then put it on you will be too tall and the only way I've been able to fix it without reloading is by redrawing the guardian. Over all hella good game super cute and feels smooth.
review_2: I absolutely love this game! It has such a fun little Animal Crossing feel, but also Garden of the Sea in VR. I am 60 "days" into the game and I'm not even close to finished!!! I love all of the tasks you have to do. Yes, if you don't like collecting things, the game will get repetitive. But the items you collect are all needed to construct buildings, complete upgrades, and purchase items. From chopping wood to mining rocks to fishing in lakes of lava, there's always something to do! My favorite is the farming!! There is something oddly satisfying about planting, watering, and harvesting crops as well as feeding your farm animals! I'm 50 yrs old and love this game.... so it may be geared for kids but it definitely appeals to adults! If you suffer from motion sickness, this is NOT the game for you!!!! It is smooth motion only. There is no ability to teleport.
